question: How can I find peace in difficult times?
interpretation: When life gets hard, here's what you can do: First, pray about your worries instead of keeping them inside. Second, remember that God is with you and wants to help. Third, focus on what you can control today, not what might happen tomorrow. God's peace is available to you right now, even when everything feels chaotic.

verses.text: Do not be anxious about anything, but in every situation, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving, present your requests to God. And the peace of God, which transcends all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.

God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help in trouble. Therefore we will not fear, though the earth give way and the mountains fall into the heart of the sea, though its waters roar and foam and the mountains quake with their surging.
Peace I leave with you; my peace I give you. I do not give to you as the world gives. Do not let your hearts be troubled and do not be afraid.

question: What does the Bible say about forgiveness?
interpretation: Forgiveness is simple but not easy. Here's how to do it: First, decide to forgive even if you don't feel like it - it's a choice, not a feeling. Second, pray for the person who hurt you (this helps your heart heal). Third, remember that forgiving doesn't mean trusting them again or pretending it didn't happen. You forgive to free yourself from anger and bitterness.

verses.text: For if you forgive other people when they sin against you, your heavenly Father will also forgive you. But if you do not forgive others their sins, your Father will not forgive your sins.
Be kind and compassionate to one another, forgiving each other, just as in Christ God forgave you.
Bear with each other and forgive one another if any of you has a grievance against someone. Forgive as the Lord forgave you.

question: How should I handle conflict with others?
interpretation: Here's how to handle disagreements: First, talk to the person privately and calmly about what's bothering you. Second, listen to their side of the story without interrupting. Third, speak kindly even when you're upset - harsh words make things worse. Fourth, focus on solving the problem, not winning the argument. The goal is to keep the relationship healthy.

verses.text: If your brother or sister sins, go and point out their fault, just between the two of you. If they listen to you, you have won them over. But if they will not listen, take one or two others along, so that 'every matter may be established by the testimony of two or three witnesses.' If they still refuse to listen, tell it to the church; and if they refuse to listen even to the church, treat them as you would a pagan or a tax collector.
A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.
If it is possible, as far as it depends on you, live at peace with everyone.

question: What is the meaning of true love?
interpretation: Real love is about what you do, not just how you feel. Here's what it looks like: First, be patient when someone annoys you. Second, be kind even when they're having a bad day. Third, put their needs before your own sometimes. Fourth, don't keep track of their mistakes. Love is choosing to care for someone even when it's hard work.

verses.text: Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud. It does not dishonor others, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs. Love does not delight in evil but rejoices with the truth. It always protects, always trusts, always hopes, always perseveres. Love never fails.
Greater love has no one than this: to lay down one's life for one's friends.
We love because he first loved us.

question: How can I overcome fear and anxiety?
interpretation: When you feel scared or worried, try these steps: First, tell God exactly what you're afraid of - be specific. Second, remember that God is bigger than your problems and He's on your side. Third, focus on today instead of worrying about tomorrow. Fourth, do something practical about what you can control, and trust God with what you can't.

verses.text: So do not fear, for I am with you; do not be dismayed, for I am your God. I will strengthen you and help you; I will uphold you with my righteous right hand.
For God has not given us a spirit of fear, but of power, of love and of sound mind.
Even though I walk through the darkest valley, I will fear no evil, for you are with me; your rod and your staff, they comfort me.
